LanguageData.Plant_Cotton_Wild.label: wild cotton plant
LanguageData.Plant_Cotton_Wild.description: A mid-size crop that yields fine white cotton fibers. These are used to make cloth.
LanguageData.Plant_Fibercorn_Wild.label: wild fibercorn
LanguageData.Plant_Fibercorn_Wild.description: An inedible, fibrous plant which produces a small amount of a wood-like substance.
LanguageData.Plant_Psychoid_Wild.label: wild psychoid plant
LanguageData.Plant_Psychoid_Wild.description: A leafy plant which generates the chemical compound psychite. Originally evolved as a defense mechanism to ward off plant-eating animals by overstimulating and sickening them, the psychite drug can be extracted and refined into various forms for recreational use. It is addictive.
LanguageData.Plant_Smokeleaf_Wild.label: wild smokeleaf plant
LanguageData.Plant_Smokeleaf_Wild.description: A leafy crop grown for the psychological effects of chemicals in its leaves. Smokeleaf leaves can be prepared into joints at the crafting spot. Smokeleaf makes a user feel relaxed, but reduces motivation, and can be addictive.
LanguageData.Plant_Strawberry_Wild.label: wild strawberry plant
LanguageData.Plant_Strawberry_Wild.description: A low bush-like plant that yields fragile but delicious strawberries. While it isn't quite as productive calorie-for-calorie as other crops, strawberries are delicious even when raw.
LanguageData.Plant_Tinctoria_Wild.label: wild tinctoria
LanguageData.Plant_Tinctoria_Wild.description: A genetically-engineered flower-like crop which secretes a self-altering dye. Tinctoria dye can be coaxed into different colors and used to change the color of walls, buildings, and more.
LanguageData.Plant_TreeCocoa_Wild.label: wild cocoa tree
LanguageData.Plant_TreeCocoa_Wild.description: A tropical tree that produces chocolate, genetically engineered to sweeten its own product, and survive in slightly less-warm climates.
